name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "The pointless feuds and rage tweets, the conspiracism and obsessions all seem baked in—none of that seems to surprise the electorate anymore. He could win. He might win." — @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/knSrcPDq5p

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PeterAtlantic: On why Trump could still win: "The pointless feuds and rage tweets, the conspiracism and obsessions all seem baked in—none of that seems to surprise the electorate anymore. He could win. He might win." 

https://t.co/OnMychIfXd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: I wrote about “Hygiene Theater”—how restaurants, gyms, and subways have wasted millions of dollars on fancy cleaning plans to defeat a mostly airborne plague and made Americans more confused and unsafe in the process.

https://t.co/rXXqtDFJDD

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "'Just me, a 40-year-old man going to Disney World by himself,' I answered. 'Is that strange?'

'Not at all,' she lied chirpily. (The correct answer, of course, was 'Not until you put it that way.')"

Read about @gcaw's visit to PandemicLand here:
https://t.co/aX0QBSXIgA

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @thebanderson: “Personal space is finally back in style, but re-creating it after two decades of its destruction is hardly a straightforward task.”

@amandamull on the return of walls: https://t.co/V33q4UEZ9I https://t.co/qW9cnYv2Bm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Many of us are now riddled with anxiety over whether we’ll send our kids back to school, even part-time, or keep them home," @russell_nm writes: https://t.co/xU9Vl6SIAZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is considering leaving her husband because he doesn’t want another baby. https://t.co/BLXy5B7Axr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Walt Disney World has reopened and @gcaw spent a weekend riding rides, waving at princesses, and contemplating his mortality. https://t.co/k7kW3XJK9P

name: TheAtlantic
text: The mythology of racial progress exerts a power­ful hold on our minds, @jaricheson has found in her research. That hold is hard to break, she writes—and it undermines actual progress. https://t.co/IlBrPXozV8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Being married seems to make the pandemic more bearable. But the coronavirus could make getting married even harder for millions of Americans, @EmilyBobrow writes: https://t.co/ex3gMSmGzk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the past 20 years, in offices and homes, we steadily tore walls down. Now, amid the pandemic, we’re building them back up, @amandamull reports: https://t.co/8lssph55bG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @LoriGottlieb1: “A marriage isn’t the Pain Olympics. Whose pain wins? In this kind of setup, both people inevitably lose.”

This week @theatlantic: Why happiness in a marriage depends more on how we choose to view a situation than in whether we get our way

https://t.co/R0smrC0aP2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gcaw: Last weekend @TheAtlantic sent me to Disney World to take rides, eat corn dogs, and wait in line with the Disney super-fans: https://t.co/XcLVaqk0He

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Hygiene theater builds a false sense of security, which can ironically lead to more infections," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/kTTFLtP86o

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Lawmakers and the public will honor John Lewis today as he lies in state at the U.S. Capitol.

Earlier this month, Adam Serwer argued that Lewis was one of "the leaders of an incomplete revolution that remade American society.” https://t.co/qd46JhAGkg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The modern rise of American craft brewing has been a genuine success story of entrepreneurship, localism, constructive business creativity, and in many places, of civic renewal." @JamesFallows on how craft brewing will survive the pandemic: https://t.co/Ucn3rx5cz6

name: TheAtlantic
text: The latest episode of the Social Distance podcast features staff writer Graeme Wood making his first visit to Walt Disney World in the midst of the pandemic: https://t.co/Su7GtRL9jk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "By funneling our anxieties into empty cleaning rituals, we lose focus on the more common modes of COVID-19 transmission and the most crucial policies to stop this plague." https://t.co/Iqu6x2pG1E

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's approval rating stands at 38 percent, and no president since Harry Truman has won reelection with less than 40 percent. But there are at least six ways the president could still pull off a November surprise, @PeterAtlantic writes: https://t.co/o1DwjFc97o

name: TheAtlantic
text: “A Disney vacation, even in pre-coronavirus conditions, sounds to me like the most elaborate way to have a miserable time yet invented,” @gcaw writes. “The chance of being struck dead by a mysterious disease has not sweetened the appeal of the park.” https://t.co/U8XuueqSyW

name: TheAtlantic
text: “A Disney vacation, even in pre-coronavirus conditions, sounds to me like the most elaborate way to have a miserable time yet invented,” @gcaw writes. “The chance of being struck dead by a mysterious disease has not sweetened the appeal of the park.” https://t.co/pKZ1st8aCu
